Description: Rim and neck sherd of Laconian black-glazed pottery krater; interior glazed black; top and underside of rim, and neck glazed; creamy slip on exterior surface of rim with painted decoration consisting of black elongated battlement pattern between rows of single dots.
Curator's comments: Stibbe places this sherd in the experimental section of his Group E, the group of kraters with geometric rim ornaments only (Stibbe, 1989, 33-4).
Bibliographic references: Stibbe 1989 / Laconian Mixing Bowls. A history of the Krater Lakonikos from the 7th to the 5th century BC (p. 99, no. E15) (Mislabels rim decoration type as 14 when it ought to be 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.46) (phase 3)
